definition: to tie/bind or fasten together/to kidnap
to prick/to run or stick (a needle etc) into/jug (a classifier for liquids such as beer)
to tie/to bind/classifier for flowers, banknotes etc: bundle/Taiwan pr. [zha2]

sentences.english: Suitable lashing arrangement at container stanchions to be provided.
sentences.chinese: 集装箱支柱上要安装合适的绑扎装置。

sentences.english: Sailors employed in lashing and securing On deck cargoes.
sentences.chinese: 水手从事于绑扎和系定甲板货。

sentences.english: In addition, I bound the handle and ear areas some more to hold down the sinew.
sentences.chinese: 我额外地绑扎把手和耳的地方固定筋腱。

sentences.english: Sema bound with two plants, the papyrus and the lotus.
sentences.chinese: Sema用两种植物，纸草和荷花绑扎一起。

sentences.english: The nurse will strap up your wound.
Another story is that the fringes were there to provide a ready source of buckskin thongs for tying.
sentences.chinese: 另一个说法是鹿皮带缘饰可以随时用来绑扎东西。

sentences.english: Fold bundle all good stone cage products, is a independent individuals.

sentences.english: We ' II untie the lashings between the containers on deck. Discharging will begin at once.
sentences.chinese: 我们将拆除甲板上集装箱的绑扎物，马上开始卸船了。

sentences.english: Point gluing together with copper wire fastening may be applied to interior walls.
sentences.chinese: 室内墙面可采用结构胶点粘结合铜丝绑扎工艺。

sentences.english: For lashing of containers a grating type walkway will be arranged between hatches.
sentences.chinese: 为了绑扎集装箱，舱口之间要安排栅条型过道。

definition: a boom (i.e. transverse beam for hanging objects)
to support/to bear the weight of (a building)
to construct by hoisting ready-built components into place
